In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a Julia function named `wrap_string` which takes a string and a `text_width` as inputs. It will add a new line each time a `text_width` is exceeded.

```julia
function wrap_string(s::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(s)
    result = []

    for word in words
        if isempty(result)
            push!(result, word)
        else
            line = join(result)
            if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
                push!(result, word)
                push!(result, "")
            else
                push!(result, line * " " * word)
            end
        end
    end

    return join(filter(!isempty, result), "\n")
end
```

You can try this function with the following example:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed euismod, nisl a fringilla condimentum, sem libero volutpat nisl, at dapibus sapien orci eget lectus. Nullam vitae tincidunt mauris, sed viverra nulla. Vivamus vel volutpat nunc, et scelerisque mauris. Nullam eleifend est vel odio dapibus, a euismod velit feugiat."

print(wrap_string(s))
```
